benchmark_details.name: Common Corpus
benchmark_details.overview: Common Corpus is the largest open dataset for language model pre-training, assembled from uncopyrighted or permissible licensed data amounting to about two trillion tokens, covering a variety of languages and domains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an open dataset for pre-training large language models that is compliant with data security regulations.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Common Corpus does not contain data for instruction-tuning and task-specific fine-tuning.

data.source: Compiles numerous datasets including Open Government, Open Culture, Open Science, Open Code, Open Web, and Open Semantic.
data.annotation: Metadata includes document provenance and license information.

methodology.calculation: Token counts and composition verified through detailed provenance.
methodology.interpretation: Dataset designed to ensure quality and compliance for LLM training.
methodology.validation: Dataset composition validated through extensive provenance documentation.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Includes diverse languages, yet shallow coverage for low-resource languages.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Personally identifiable information removed in compliance with GDPR.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data primarily falls under Public Domain and various permissive licenses.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Designed to meet legal and regulatory requirements across various jurisdictions.
